name: The Lofts at the Five & Dime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were four people who stayed in a condominium at The Lofts at the Five & Dime. We were almost shocked when we walked across the threshold of our apartment. Yes, the room is in fact an apartment with fully equipped kitchen, two bathrooms, shower, a flat screen TV, a DVD player and DVDs. The apartment was luxurious, spacious, clean, and simply the coolest place we stayed at. This place is situated in the city center of Clarksdale within close walking distance to Red's Blues Club, Ground Zero Blues Club, The Delta Blues Museum, The Riverside Hotel and other places of interest. We recommend all visitors to Clarksdale to book themselves at The Loft at the Five & Dime. We will definately do that the next time we visit Clarksdale.
reviews.title: The most fantastic place to stay (for real)!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: If You are in the Mississippi Delta(Clarksdale,MS) looking for some great Blues Music.I recommend the Five and Dime Lofts in downtown Clarksdale. Plenty of space,decorated in modern Blues themes(each loft is different),makes it the perfect place to stay.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was a fantastic place to stay in Clarksdale, Mississippi. Anytime you want to feel the comforts of a big city loft in an eclectic, wonderful small Mississippi town, come to Clarksdale and stay at the Lofts. Be sure to visit with Bubba O'Keefe who is a wonderful tour guide to the town and the Yazoo Pass coffee spot downstairs is a wonderful place for food, drinks, and seeing the locals.
reviews.title: City Lofts in the Delta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We went to Clarksdale on business, and we stayed at the Lofts at the Five and Dime on the recommendation of one of our associates. We could not have been more pleased. The lofts are very well appointed condominium units situated in downtown Clarksdale within walking distance of restaurants, shops, and other points of interest. The Yazoo Pass coffee shop, next door to the lofts, is a newly opened space featuring fresh-baked pastries, strong coffee, and light meals. It has already become a hub of downtown activity with lots of sunny space where you can get comfortable, read the paper, or open your laptop to start the day. Morgan Freeman's Madidi Restaurants is half a block away if you are looking for truly fine dining, and for lunch, Ox Bow Diner is a block and a half in the other direction. There are other restaurants near by. These are just the two we tried and enjoyed. The Lofts feature free wi-fi internet access, a full kitchen, widescreen televisions, one and one-half well-equipped bathrooms, a comfortable king size bed, and a walk in closet. On street parking is ample and free. Rates are very reasonable for accommodations of this superior quality.
reviews.title: Great Downtown Space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A group of us took lofts at the Five and Dime. We were the entire building! It was so beautiful and well appointed and so wonderfully welcoming and well managed. We wanted for nothing and then Clarksdale, Mississippi is just a gold mine of music and food and scenery. The cotton was in bloom, the pecans were just picked and music wafted out of every corner we passed. What a perfect place to be together with friends and to explore and photograph. Can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Southern Comfort Susie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I travel to Clarksdale two or three times a year to enjoy the blues and wonderful people. We enjoy upscale accomodations and were always disappointed until we discovered The Lofts at the Five and Dime. Each apartment is large, comfortable, clean, new and right in the middle of everything. We easily walk to all the clubs and attractions. The manager, Bubba O'Keefe, is a wonderful man and the best ambassador Clarksdale can hope to have. Stay there and you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: The only place I want to stay in Clarksdale.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am so fortunate to have found "The Lofts" in Clarksdale MS. I, like another reviewer, practically live in hotels in MS, LA, TN, TX, AR, and MO and I have never stayed a night in a better place than The Lofts at Five and Dime. In the past when I have had business in this part of the state, I have spent many hours and long days driving to and from simply because of the lack of decent and safe hotels in the area. I look forward to returning to Clarksdale, MS in the future and would highly recomend "The Lofts" to anyone, be it business or pleasure. My thanks to Scott Middleton of Delta Oil Mill in Jonestown and Greenwood MS for recomending this truly awesome place.
reviews.title: Better than Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ricky Lawrence
reviews.title: DONT MISS THIS OPPORTUNITY!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ICWUC/UFCW
reviews.title: The nicest place I've ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: VP/Reginal Director
reviews.title: Would not hesitate to stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nearly missed out on this wonderful place, because it's hidden away under 'specialty lodging' on TripAdvisor. We booked Loft A, and it's a knock-out -- spacious, tall, well-lit, 2-room apartment, fully-equipped kitchen, large bathroom, all brand new, furnished and decorated with great taste and amazing art. We didn't get to meet Bubba (out of town) but we did meet the very nice owner of Loft A (they are individually owned) who was in town and came to welcome us. It felt like staying in a personal friend's guest suite!
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's right in the middle of Clarksdale's old 'downtown', with parking right outside, the new Yazoo Pass cafe underneath, serving breakfast and other snacks, and easy walks to the excellent Blues Museum, Ground Zero club, and Rust restaurant where we ate great food in a very friendly local-Clarksdale atmosphere. There was also a good blues/country singer (Grace Askew) performing there (Friday night). Unfortunately at Ground Zero there was only a trashy rock band!
reviews.title: Unexpected Treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Clarksdale is a bit run down, and looks grim on the Google StreetView, but we English sixty-somethings really enjoyed our short stay there - thanks to The Lofts.
reviews.title: In Clarksdale? Really?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family decided to travel to Clarksdale to enjoy a weekend away and some blues. From the time I reached out to Bubba O'Keefe to learn about the Lofts and how it was situated in the middle of everything you wanted to experience in Clarksdale, to the time I exited and he called me to let me know we left a coat behind and how could he arrange to get the lost item back to me, the experience was nothing but customer focused. The accommodations were very spacious, including an amazing full kitchen, 1 and 1/2 baths, a living room and bedroom with more room than you know what to do with. Bubba was a wealth of knowledge about Clarksdale and all the key attractions, restaurants and clubs we should not pass up. Our stay was perfect, in a well appointed room, very clean, comfortable and with amazing amenities and a touch of classic southern hospitality. If you have the opportunity to roll into Clarksdale, you should not miss the chance to experience the Lofts at the Five & Dime.
reviews.title: a Wedding Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If I hadn't known better, I would have sworn I was in New York or LA, or any other cosmopolitan area. This is one of the coolest places I've ever stayed, without doubt. I was in Clarksdale with my brother, sister, and brother-in-law for a blues weekend. We each had our own apartment, and they were all breathtaking!!!! Large, bright, airy, with unbelievable furnishings. I cannot recommend this place highly enough. And as an added bonus, almost everything we wanted to see or do was within walking distance--Ground Zero, Red's, Cathead, Rock and Blues Museum, I could go on and on. Run, don't walk to the Lofts at the Five and Dime. You won't believe you're in Clarksdale!!!
reviews.title: Overwhelmingly Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great location. You are within walking distance of all the sights to see and some really great restaurants.
reviews.title: Our loft was beautifully decorated and very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An absolutely amazing place in fabulous Clarksdale! My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and look forward to a longer one soon. If you are looking for a comfortable, well-appointed, stylish place to stay while in Clarksdale look no further than The Lofts!
reviews.title: A jewel in Clarksdale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Great place, very modern and it is huge, full living room with kitchen, separate bedroom, full bath and separate 1/2 bath and it even had a washer and dryer, it was located in the middle of everything. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife booked us here for 2 nights new years 2011. i had wanted to go south and check out the blues in the area. the place was nice, roomy had every thing we needed for a great get away. our host,bubba checked on us regularly gave us advice but did not push anything on us. we could walk downtown most places, clubs,dinner,ect. i felt safe and was not worried about my wife and myself. we are already planing on going back in near future and have told our friends about the place and area. a great value we loved the place would not want to stay anywhere else, even if ya paid me
reviews.title: great new years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Come to Clarksdale and settle in for a few days. And when you do, be sure to stay at the Lofts at the Five and Dime. The lofts are located on the top floor of a converted Woolworth's building and feature high ceilings and plenty of light. Each loft has a kitchen, so you can cook for yourself, but the town's coffee shop, just downstairs from the lofts, was such a friendly place that we spent our mornings there. And although we're not really t.v. people, we took advantage of it to watch a few of the dvd's provided - such as "M for Mississippi" - a locally produced documentary about the blues that was a great foundation for our visit.
reviews.title: Big city comfort in a charming small town

description: Centrally located in downtown Clarksdale, Mississippi, The Five and Dime Lofts offer overnight accommodations in a small town setting with modern conveniences and amenities. The Lofts reside in the upper level of the Woolworth building, Clarksdale’s first historic tax credit project. There are 6 lofts with full kitchen, spacious living area, bedroom, bath and washer/dryer. Visit Clarksdale and stay at The Five and Dime Lofts, full of rich history in an urban contemporary setting.
